characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654823 | sample_plate_position: H02 | sentrix_id: 202242400020 | sentrix_position: R08C01 | participant_id: PT-1A32A | sample_id: SM-GW1V2 | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1A32A | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Never
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654822 | sample_plate_position: B03 | sentrix_id: 202242400199 | sentrix_position: R02C01 | participant_id: PT-1F5PL | sample_id: SM-GW1QA | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1F5PL | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 40-49 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654822 | sample_plate_position: A11 | sentrix_id: 202259350003 | sentrix_position: R01C01 | participant_id: PT-1HSGN | sample_id: SM-GW1Q6 | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1HSGN | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 40-49 | smoker_status: Never
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654822 | sample_plate_position: H04 | sentrix_id: 202242400220 | sentrix_position: R08C01 | participant_id: PT-1K9T9 | sample_id: SM-GW1SD | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1K9T9 | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Never
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654824 | sample_plate_position: B09 | sentrix_id: 202250790012 | sentrix_position: R02C01 | participant_id: PT-1PIEJ | sample_id: SM-GW1VX | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1PIEJ | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 20-29 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654826 | sample_plate_position: E11 | sentrix_id: 202242410162 | sentrix_position: R05C01 | participant_id: PT-P4PP | sample_id: SM-GW23I | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-P4PP | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 30-39 | smoker_status: Never
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654152 | sample_plate_position: G10 | sentrix_id: 202242410028 | sentrix_position: R07C01 | participant_id: PT-T5JW | sample_id: SM-GW1BB | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-T5JW | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 20-29 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654152 | sample_plate_position: G11 | sentrix_id: 202242410083 | sentrix_position: R07C01 | participant_id: PT-WWYW | sample_id: SM-GW1BC | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-WWYW | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Ovary | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654825 | sample_plate_position: A02 | sentrix_id: 202232360076 | sentrix_position: R01C01 | participant_id: PT-XYKS | sample_id: SM-GW1Y5 | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-XYKS | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: None | tissue: Ovary | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654825 | sample_plate_position: B05 | sentrix_id: 202242400065 | sentrix_position: R02C01 | participant_id: PT-ZZPU | sample_id: SM-GW1YK | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-ZZPU | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: None | tissue: Ovary | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654152 | sample_plate_position: E02 | sentrix_id: 202242400077 | sentrix_position: R05C01 | participant_id: PT-11ZU8 | sample_id: SM-GW1AE | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-11ZU8 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Prostate | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Former
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654154 | sample_plate_position: E09 | sentrix_id: 202259340144 | sentrix_position: R05C01 | participant_id: PT-139TT | sample_id: SM-GW1G3 | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-139TT | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Moderate | tissue: Prostate | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654152 | sample_plate_position: F08 | sentrix_id: 202242400223 | sentrix_position: R06C01 | participant_id: PT-147GR | sample_id: SM-GW1AW | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-147GR | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Severe | tissue: Prostate | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Former
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654823 | sample_plate_position: F11 | sentrix_id: 202250790071 | sentrix_position: R06C01 | participant_id: PT-16YQH | sample_id: SM-GW1UM | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-16YQH | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Prostate | age: 30-39 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654823 | sample_plate_position: G01 | sentrix_id: 202242400010 | sentrix_position: R07C01 | participant_id: PT-1F75W | sample_id: SM-GW1UO | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1F75W | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Severe | tissue: Prostate | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654824 | sample_plate_position: F02 | sentrix_id: 202242400015 | sentrix_position: R06C01 | participant_id: PT-1HSKV | sample_id: SM-GW1X4 | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1HSKV | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Moderate | tissue: Prostate | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: NA
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654825 | sample_plate_position: B10 | sentrix_id: 202242400146 | sentrix_position: R02C01 | participant_id: PT-RUSQ | sample_id: SM-GW1YP | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-RUSQ | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Moderate | tissue: Prostate | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Never
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654154 | sample_plate_position: B05 | sentrix_id: 202242400029 | sentrix_position: R02C01 | participant_id: PT-SNMC | sample_id: SM-GW1EX | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-SNMC | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Prostate | age: 20-29 | smoker_status: Never
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654153 | sample_plate_position: C08 | sentrix_id: 202259350096 | sentrix_position: R03C01 | participant_id: PT-WHSE | sample_id: SM-GW1CM | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-WHSE | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Severe | tissue: Prostate | age: 20-29 | smoker_status: NA
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654152 | sample_plate_position: C03 | sentrix_id: 202242400091 | sentrix_position: R03C01 | participant_id: PT-X585 | sample_id: SM-GW19Q | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-X585 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Severe | tissue: Prostate | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Former
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25655788 | sample_plate_position: C04 | sentrix_id: 202234390052 | sentrix_position: R03C01 | participant_id: PT-YB5E | sample_id: SM-GW2AC | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-YB5E | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Prostate | age: 40-49 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25655788 | sample_plate_position: D09 | sentrix_id: 202250790199 | sentrix_position: R04C01 | participant_id: PT-12KS4 | sample_id: SM-GW2AT | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-12KS4 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Testis | age: 30-39 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654823 | sample_plate_position: H08 | sentrix_id: 202242410198 | sentrix_position: R08C01 | participant_id: PT-13O3P | sample_id: SM-GW1V8 | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-13O3P | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Moderate | tissue: Testis | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Former
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654154 | sample_plate_position: G11 | sentrix_id: 202259350119 | sentrix_position: R07C01 | participant_id: PT-18465 | sample_id: SM-GW1GT | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-18465 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Mild | tissue: Testis | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654154 | sample_plate_position: E03 | sentrix_id: 202242400011 | sentrix_position: R05C01 | participant_id: PT-SIU8 | sample_id: SM-GW1FW | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-SIU8 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: Severe | tissue: Testis | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654825 | sample_plate_position: A12 | sentrix_id: 202242410030 | sentrix_position: R01C01 | participant_id: PT-11EMC | sample_id: SM-GW1YF | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-11EMC | Sex: 2 | autolysis_score: NA | tissue: Whole Blood | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654154 | sample_plate_position: D02 | sentrix_id: 202232360060 | sentrix_position: R04C01 | participant_id: PT-13NYS | sample_id: SM-GW1FJ | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-13NYS | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: NA | tissue: Whole Blood | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654151 | sample_plate_position: E10 | sentrix_id: 202250790129 | sentrix_position: R05C01 | participant_id: PT-15EU6 | sample_id: SM-GW17V | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-15EU6 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: NA | tissue: Whole Blood | age: 50-59 | smoker_status: NA
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654826 | sample_plate_position: D04 | sentrix_id: 202242400165 | sentrix_position: R04C01 | participant_id: PT-1J1R8 | sample_id: SM-GW22Y | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-1J1R8 | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: NA | tissue: Whole Blood | age: 40-49 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.

characteristics: sample_plate: CO-25654151 | sample_plate_position: E02 | sentrix_id: 202242410053 | sentrix_position: R05C01 | participant_id: PT-X4XX | sample_id: SM-GW17N | collaborator_participant_id: GTEX-X4XX | Sex: 1 | autolysis_score: NA | tissue: Whole Blood | age: 60-69 | smoker_status: Current
extract_protocol_ch1: DNA samples were extracted from GTEx tissue samples using Qiagen Gentra Puregene method at GTEx Laboratory Data, Analysis and Coordinating Center (LDACC), and sent to the Institute for Population and Precision Health Laboratory on 96-well plates. Tissue types were not batched by plate. Bisulfite conversion was applied to 500 ng of DNA using EZ-96 DNA methylation kit (Zymo Research, Irvine, CA, USA).
hyb_protocol: All samples were  prepared and analyzed in accordance with the manufacturer guidelines and protocol for the Illumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC array (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA). That is, bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to IIllumina Infinium HumanMethylationEPIC BeadChip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Raw DNAm data was processed with ChAMP software. For sample quality control (QC), we excluded (1) 3 samples with undetectable or missing methylation values (detection P > 0.01) in ≥ 5% of CpGs and (2) 6 samples with mismatched sex. For CpG QC, we excluded (1) CpGs that had detection P > 0.01 in ≥ 1 samples (N = 44,135) and that had a beadcount < 3 in ≥ 5% samples (N = 660), (2) cross-reactive CpGs (N = 40,812), (3) variant-overlapping CpGs or within a single base pair extension (N = 7,708) and (4) CpGs mapping to sex chromosomes. For filters (2) and (3), we selected CpG probes overlapping variants defined at MAF > 5% in 1000G. A total of 754,054 CpGs passed QC, could be mapped and lifted over from GRCh37 to GRCh38 human genome build and were retained for further analysis. Raw DNAm values were background-adjusted using the single sample normal-exponential out-of-band (ssnoob) method with dye bias correction. DNAm β values were normalized using the beta mixture quantile (BMIQ) method, adjusting for type I/II probe bias; output β values for each CpG were used in downstream analysis. After normalization, we removed one additional sample with array-derived genotype profile not matching the WGS-derived one. Principal component analysis (PCA) was conducted on DNAm β values within each tissue type, and 3 samples were removed for being outliers with respect to the top 5 principal components (PCs) of the corresponding tissue. A total of 987 samples passed final QC and were retained for further analysis.
